articles.headline: Technology Coalition Seeks Stronger Privacy Laws
articles.snippet: Microsoft, Google and other companies are pushing to protect private information from government access.
articles.abstract: Microsoft, Google and other companies are pushing to protect private information from government access.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A broad coalition of technology companies, including AT&T, Google and Microsoft, and advocacy groups from across the political spectrum said Tuesday that it would push Congress to strengthen online privacy laws to protect private digital information from government access.

articles.headline: Ford Shifts and Gains Ground in Asia
articles.snippet: Ford has cut back on luxury models and increased output of smaller, fuel-efficient cars.
articles.abstract: Ford has cut back on luxury models and increased output of smaller, fuel-efficient cars.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHONGQING, China — The sprawling Ford assembly plant here runs two shifts a day every day except Sunday, with workers putting in as many as 10 hours a day. Employees take turns having lunch so production almost never stops at potential bottlenecks, like the building where cars are painted.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher and Vikas Bajaj

articles.headline: Oil Prices Find a Sweet Spot for World Economy
articles.snippet: Prices are high enough to drive investment and prompt conservation but low enough for the economy to grow.
articles.abstract: Prices are high enough to drive investment and prompt conservation but low enough for the economy to grow.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Oil prices have done something remarkable over the last half-year or so: they have barely budged.

articles.headline:
Risks Seen in Cholesterol Drug Use
 in Healthy People
articles.snippet: A drug giant is about to expand the market for its cholesterol medication, but some experts say that these drugs are not safe as preventive medicine.
articles.abstract: A drug giant is about to expand the market for its cholesterol medication, but some experts say that these drugs are not safe as preventive medicine.
articles.lead_paragraph: With the government’s blessing, a drug giant is about to expand the market for its blockbuster cholesterol medication Crestor to a new category of customers: as a preventive measure for millions of people who do not have cholesterol problems.

articles.headline: Suicides, Some for Separatist Cause, Jolt India
articles.snippet: Suicide has become a phenomenon in India, alarming public health experts.
articles.abstract: Suicide has become a phenomenon in India, alarming public health experts.
articles.lead_paragraph: HYDERABAD, India — Sai Kumar Meegada, a 20-year-old straight-A chemical engineering student at a prestigious university here, came home from breakfast one morning early this month, slipped a length of clothesline around his neck, tied it to the ceiling fan in his dorm room and hanged himself.

articles.headline: Despite Doubt, Karzai Brother Retains Power
articles.snippet: Officials have decided that Ahmed Wali Karzai, suspected of ties to drugs and insurgents,  will be allowed to stay.
articles.abstract: Officials have decided that Ahmed Wali Karzai, suspected of ties to drugs and insurgents,  will be allowed to stay.
articles.lead_paragraph: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan — Ahmed Wali Karzai, the most powerful man in southern Afghanistan, may maintain links with drug dealers and insurgents, as some American officials and Afghans believe. And he might have played a central role in last summer’s fraudulent presidential election, as Western diplomats charged.

articles.headline: Weak Rules on Toxins and Safety
articles.snippet: America has not been as aggressive as it could be in alleviating toxic risks in everyday products.
articles.abstract: America has not been as aggressive as it could be in alleviating toxic risks in everyday products.
articles.lead_paragraph: For 14 years until just last month, GlaxoSmithKline sold a denture cream called Super Poligrip that contained high levels of zinc.

articles.headline: After Patent on Genes Is Invalidated, Taking Stock
articles.snippet: Many biotechnology stocks fell as investors struggled to understand the impact of the far-reaching ruling.
articles.abstract: Many biotechnology stocks fell as investors struggled to understand the impact of the far-reaching ruling.
articles.lead_paragraph: Many biotechnology stocks fell on Tuesday as investors struggled to understand the impact of a ruling that threw out parts of two gene patents and called into question thousands more.

articles.headline: Chechen Rebel Says He Planned Attacks
articles.snippet: Doku K. Umarov, a former separatist, offered himself as the face of an increasingly lethal pan-Caucasus insurgency.
articles.abstract: Doku K. Umarov, a former separatist, offered himself as the face of an increasingly lethal pan-Caucasus insurgency.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — A former Chechen separatist who reinvented himself as a proponent of global jihad stepped out of the shadows on Wednesday to take responsibility for two suicide bombings on Moscow’s subway, and to offer himself as the face of an increasingly lethal pan-Caucasus insurgency.
